alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 3:32PM EDT until June 29 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT/430 PM EDT/ FOR WABASH...GIBSON AND PIKE COUNTIES... At 231 PM CDT/331 PM EDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Vincennes to near St. Francisville to West Salem, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Princeton, Mount Carmel, Oakland City, Petersburg, Lancaster, Owensville, Winslow, Patoka, Allendale, Francisco, Somerville, Bellmont, Hazleton, Decker and Keensburg. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 30 and 52. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
